chapter.title: How to size and layout your charts

subsection.title: Data series, stacked bar and ratio bar charts
subsection.p:
You can use the following chart level parameters to help size and layout your data series, stacked bar and ratio bar charts.
chart-height
chart-width
plot-height
plot-width
plot-x-offset
plot-y-offset
label-font-angle
legend-top-offset
legend-offset
legend-max-width
subsection.note: To see a complete list of chart parameters take a look at our macro reference page.

subsection.title: What to do when your x-axis labels cannot be seen
subsection.p: A common problem, especially when using cards as the value of a x-axis property, is that the x-axis labels will extend out of the chart area.

screenshot.alttext: Data series chart with cut off x plot offset

subsection.p:
There are a couple of ways that this can be resolved:
Extend the chart-height, chart-width and plot-x-offset to allow for the extended names.
Rotate the x-axis labels using label-font-angle.
subsection.note: This chart has x-axis labels shown at an angle of 90 degrees.

screenshot.alttext: Data series chart with rotated x axis labels

subsection.title: Display chart legend inside the chart plot area
subsection.p: To show the chart legend inside the chart area use a negative legend-offset. For example, the following chart has a legend-offset of -150.

screenshot.alttext: Data series chart with rotated x axis labels

subsection.title: Pie charts
subsection.p:
You can use the following chart level parameters to help size and layout your pie chart.
chart-height
chart-width
radius
For example, this pie chart has a radius of 20.
